org.zaproxy.zap.view.messagecontainer

Interface SelectableMessagesContainer<T extends Message>

  • Type Parameters:
    T - the type of messages in this container
    All Superinterfaces:
    MessageContainer<T>, MultipleMessagesContainer<T>, SingleMessageContainer<T>
    All Known Subinterfaces:
    SelectableHistoryReferencesContainer, SelectableHttpMessagesContainer
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    DefaultSelectableHistoryReferencesContainer, DefaultSelectableHttpMessagesContainer

    public interface SelectableMessagesContainer<T extends Message>
extends MultipleMessagesContainer<T>
    A MultipleMessagesContainer that exposes the selected messages in the GUI component.
    Since:
    2.3.0
    See Also:
    MessageContainer, MultipleMessagesContainer, SingleMessageContainer

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      int getNumberOfSelectedMessages()
      Returns the number of selected messages.
      T getSelectedMessage()
      Returns the selected message or null if none.
      List<T> getSelectedMessages()
      Returns all the selected messages or an empty List if none.
      boolean hasSelectedMessages()
      Tells whether or not there is at least one message selected.
      boolean isOnlyOneMessageSelected()
      Tells whether or not only and only one message is selected.

      • Methods inherited from interface org.zaproxy.zap.view.messagecontainer.MultipleMessagesContainer

        getMessage, getMessages, getNumberOfMessages

      • Methods inherited from interface org.zaproxy.zap.view.messagecontainer.MessageContainer

        getComponent, getName, isEmpty

    • Method Detail

      • hasSelectedMessages

        boolean hasSelectedMessages()
        Tells whether or not there is at least one message selected.
        Returns:
        true if at least one message is selected, false otherwise.

      • isOnlyOneMessageSelected

        boolean isOnlyOneMessageSelected()
        Tells whether or not only and only one message is selected.
        Returns:
        true if only one message is selected, false otherwise.

      • getSelectedMessage

        T getSelectedMessage()
        Returns the selected message or null if none. If multiple messages are selected the first one is returned.
        Returns:
        the selected message or null if none.

      • getNumberOfSelectedMessages

        int getNumberOfSelectedMessages()
        Returns the number of selected messages.
        Returns:
        the number of selected messages.

      • getSelectedMessages

        List<T> getSelectedMessages()
        Returns all the selected messages or an empty List if none.

        No assumptions should be made on the actual implementation type of the List returned by this method (for example, it might be unmodifiable or its elements lazy loaded).

        Note: Extra care should be taken when getting the messages from the list since it might return null which indicate that an error occurred while getting a message (for example, failed to read a persisted message).

        Returns:
        a List with all the selected messages, never null.
